text: Greg MacPherson (born 1973) is a Canadian singer-songwriter based in Winnipeg, Manitoba. MacPherson performs both solo and with a backing band. MacPherson's sixth album, Mr. Invitation, was released on March 30, 2010, and was longlisted for the 2010 Polaris Music Prize. In addition to his musical career, MacPherson co-owns Canadian indie label Disintegration Records, and works as a community organizer in Winnipeg's inner city. He has previously released albums on G7 Welcoming Committee Records, and more recently Smallman Records. The independent record label play/rec, based in Copenhagen, has released a compilation LP in Europe. His two most recent albums, Disintegration Blues in 2011 and Fireball in 2013, were released on his own Disintegration Records following the demise of both G7 Welcoming Committee Records and Smallman Records."Greg MacPherson Announces 'Fireball' LP, Maps Out Canadian Tour Dates" . Exclaim!, September 23, 2013. Fireball was a longlisted nominee for the 2014 Polaris Music Prize."After a glitch, Polaris adds Greg MacPherson to the long list". The Globe and Mail, June 25, 2014. In 2017 MacPherson collaborated with Rob Gardiner in the project Figure Walking,"Greg MacPherson Announces Debut LP as Figure Walking". Exclaim!, February 23, 2017. whose debut album The Big Other was a longlisted nominee for the 2017 Polaris Music Prize."Gord Downie, Tragically Hip both make cut as Polaris Prize long list revealed".
